affect rice production and net income of rice farmers.

This section gives a synthesis of this chapter on innovation and technology development and transfer,
In conjunction with other enabling conditions, technological innovati
to limit warming, help shift development pathways, and bring about new and improved ways of
delivering goods and services that are essential to human well
offs that undermine both progress on mitigation and
progress towards other sustainable development goals. Trade
as environmental impacts and social inequalities, rebound effects leading to lower net
reductions or even increases in emissions, and increased dependency on foreign knowledge and
. Digitalisation, for example, holds both opportunity for emission reduction
saving behaviour change, but at the s
ame time causes significant environmental, social
A systemic view of innovation, that takes into account the roles of actors, institutions, and their
interactions, can contribute to both enhanced understanding of process
innovation, and to interventions and arrangements that can help innovation. It can also play a role in
offs between technological innovation and the SDGs. Effective
implemented in an inclusive, responsible and holistic way, could both make
innovation policy more effective, and avoid and minimise misalignments between climate change
mitigation, technological innovation, and other societal goals
A special feature is the dynamics of transitions. Like other enabling conditions, technological
innovation plays both a balancing role, by inhibiting change as innovation strengthens incumbent
technologies and practices, and a reinforcing role,
by allowing new technologies and practices to disrupt
organise innovation systems better, while other policies (technology push and demand pull) can provide
uitable resources and incentives to support and guide these innovation systems towards societally
desirable outcomes, ensure the innovations are deployed at scale, and direct these dynamics not just
towards system transitions for climate change mitigation,
but also towards addressing other SDGs. This
means taking into account the full life
cycle or value chain as well as analysis of synergies and trade
